instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [solved] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for one second then stops then starts then stops {CLOCK ISSUE}
threads.message:
[PLAIN][solved] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for one second then stops then starts then stops {CLOCK ISSUE}[/PLAIN]

Got this liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. There where corrosion on both sides of the board around <CHIP>U3890</CHIP>.
<RESISTOR>R3888</RESISTOR> was blown and I have replaced it. I have also replaced all the large caps above <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> since they looked really bad.
The board shows the same symptoms before and after.

Any idea that can help me a bit further with this one?

threads.title: [solved] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for one second then stops then starts then stops {CLOCK ISSUE}
threads.message: <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is probably fucked, check it. Also check resistance between pins 17/18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, but 99% it's fucked <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.

threads.title: [solved] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for one second then stops then starts then stops {CLOCK ISSUE}
threads.message: Did some measuring and I also have 0v on the output of <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR>, shouldn't there be 12,56v here?

threads.title: [solved] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for one second then stops then starts then stops {CLOCK ISSUE}
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> is in T29 circuit and is for the thunderbolt port, has nothing to do with the board working. Measure the voltage on Y2805, if over 1.6V then <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is dead.

threads.title: [solved] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for one second then stops then starts then stops {CLOCK ISSUE}
threads.message: Louis was totally right, replaced <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and the fan spins, that means that the computer is totally fine :) doesn't it?

threads.title: [solved] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for one second then stops then starts then stops {CLOCK ISSUE}
threads.message:
And off course, so are you Dukefawks :)

Thank you both so much, another success...
